hanzi-su-wiki:
肺

Значения

Лёгкие

Мнемоника

Часть тела 月, нужная на рынке 市 — лёгкие. Громко кричишь — много покупателей зазовёшь.

rtega_mnemonic:
肺肺RSlungs
  • which grows 巿 in the meat 月
  • inside the meat 月 of a person 巿
purpleculture_info: Pictophonetic: 巿 indicates the sound; ⺼ (flesh) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
肺炎 [ fèi yán ]: pneumonia; inflammation of the lungs
非典型肺炎 [ fēi diǎn xíng fèi yán ]: atypical pneumonia; Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome; SARS
肺结核 [ fèi jié hé ]: tuberculosis; TB
肺腑 [ fèi fǔ ]: bottom of the heart (fig.)
肺病 [ fèi bìng ]: lung disease
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • ⺼ meat, flesh; organic compound
    • 巿 [ fú ] to revolve, to turn, to make a circuit
heisig_chinese_memo: The PART OF THE BODY most important if you work at a MARKET is your LUNGS so that you can shout out at the top of your voice to attract customers.
heisig_constituent: lungs, moon, month, flesh, part of the body, market, top hat, towel
heisig_story: One is surprised, strolling through the market, to find among the meats hung out for sale a slab marked: lungs.
koohiiStory1: LUNGS are a PART of the BODY that can be found at any meat MARKET or black MARKET.
koohiiStory2: The PART OF THE BODY most important if you work at a MARKET is your LUNGS so that you can shout out at the top of your voice "IRASSHAIMASEEE" to attract customers.
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: There is a moon and a city inside your lung. Inside of your lung there is a city and above that city lies a moon. It’s a pretty sight, but also very strange. Moons and cities don’t usually reside inside lungs.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Imagine having a moon and a city inside your lung. Feel their presence as you breathe in and breathe out. Also, 月 often refers to internal organs as well, so remember that when you see this kanji.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: Having a moon and city inside your lung inspires you to write a haiku (はい). Perhaps the city and moon are just metaphorical. Either way, a haiku is the best way to go about things here.
WaniKani_Reading_Info:
The city and moon
Inside my lung, forgotten.
Where is the answer?
Or just think of your own haiku. Be creative!
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the body part (⺼) sold in the market (市) is the lungs
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: The PART OF THE BODY most important if you work at a MARKET is your LUNGS so that you can shout out at the top of your voice to attract customers.
humanum_full_description_en:
From the sound of " meat " and " market ", the original meaning is human breathing organ, one of the five internal organs. "Shuowen": "Golden Tibetans. From the flesh, the market sounds." "Suwen‧ Linglan Secret Code": "The lung is the official of the minister, the governor of the festival."

" Lung " also refers to the lungs of animals used for food. "Book of Rites-The Second Song of Li": "The year is fierce, and the valley does not climb, and the king does not sacrifice his lungs."

" Lung " is also a metaphor for the heart. "Xin Tang Shu·Feng Lun Biography": "However, it is good at pretending, living freely, no one can explore his lungs."
humanum_short_description_en: From the sound of " meat " and " market ", the original meaning is the human respiratory organ, one of the five internal organs.
humanum_full_description:
從「肉」，「巿」聲，本義為人的呼吸器官，五臟之一。《說文》：「金藏也。从肉，巿聲。」 《素問‧靈蘭秘典論》：「肺者，相傅之官，治節出焉。」

　　「肺」也指用作食物的動物的肺臟。《禮記‧曲禮下》：「歲凶，年穀不登，君膳不祭肺。」

　　「肺」還比喻內心。《新唐書‧封倫傳》：「然善矯飾，居之自如，人莫能探其膺肺。」
humanum_short_description: 從「肉」，「巿」聲，本義為人的呼吸器官，五臟之一。

肺(はい): lung

從「 肉 」，「 巿 」聲，本義為人的呼吸器官，五臟之一。《說文》：「金藏也。从肉，巿聲。」 《素問‧靈蘭秘典論》：「肺者，相傅之官，治節出焉。」 「 肺 」也指用作食物的動物的肺臟。《禮記‧曲禮下》：「歲凶，年穀不登，君膳不祭肺。」 「 肺 」還比喻內心。《新唐書‧封倫傳》：「然善矯飾，居之自如，人莫能探其膺肺。」
From the sound of " meat" and " market", the original meaning is human breathing organ, one of the five internal organs. "Shuowen": "Golden Tibetans. From the flesh, the market sounds." "Suwen‧ Linglan Secret Code": "The lung is the official of the minister, the governor of the festival." " Lung" also refers to the lungs of animals used for food. "Book of Rites-The Second Song of Li": "The year is fierce, and the valley does not climb, and the king does not sacrifice his lungs." " Lung" is also a metaphor for the heart. "Xin Tang Shu·Feng Lun Biography": "However, it is good at pretending, living freely, no one can explore his lungs."

Liushutong characters (1)

肺字的基本解释

肺
fèi
人和某些高级动物的呼吸器官：肺脏。肺病。

肺字的汉语字典释义

[①]［fèi］
［《廣韻》芳廢切，去廢，敷。］
“胇1”的被通假字。亦作“胏2”。
(1)人的呼吸器官。五脏之一。
(2)指用作食物的动物的肺脏。
(3)比喻内心。
(4)木札，木皮。参见“肺附”。
[②]［pèi］
［《集韻》普蓋切，去泰，滂。］
见“肺2肺”。

肺字的英文翻译

◎ 肺
haggis, lung

肺字的康熙字典解释

【未集下】【肉字部】　肺； 康熙笔画：10； 页码：页976第24
【廣韻】方廢切【集韻】【韻會】芳廢切，?音㤄。【說文】金藏也。【玉篇】肺之言敷也。【正字通】肺主藏魄，六葉兩耳，凡八葉，附脊第三椎，配胷中與大腸表裏，爲陽中大隂，通於秋氣。【素問】肺者，相傳之官，治節出焉。【禮·曲禮】年穀不登，君膳不祭肺。【註】禮，食殺牲則祭先。有虞氏以首，夏后氏以心，殷人以肝，周人以肺。不祭肺，謂不殺牲爲盛饌也。又【月令】孟夏之月，祭先肺。【史記·樂書】商動肺而和正義。【淮南子·精神訓】肺爲氣。【釋名】肺，㪍也。言其氣㪍鬱也。【博雅】肺，費也。　又肺石。【周禮·秋官·大司寇】以肺石達窮民。【註】肺石，赤石也。【疏】必使之坐赤石者，使之赤心不妄告也。　又【正韻】削木札。【史記·惠景閒侯者年表】諸侯子弟若肺腑。【註】喻人主疎末之親，如木札出於木，樹皮附於樹也。【前漢·楚元王傳】臣幸得託肺附。【註】一說肺謂斫木之肺札也。【揚子·太?經】肺附乾餱。【註】削曰肺，杮曰附。【正字通】杮附木，如肺附肝，杮胏與肺別，此義之不可通者也。韻會、讀

肺字的源字形

肺字的起名意思

人和高等动物的呼吸器官之一，后比喻内心深处，如肺腑之言。

lung
Basic explanation of words
lung
fèi
The respiratory organs of humans and some advanced animals: lungs. pulmonary disease.
lung
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［fèi］
["Guang Yun" Fang waste cut, remove waste, apply. ]
"胇1" was passed falsely. Also known as "華2".
(1) Human respiratory organs. One of the five internal organs.
(2) Refers to the lungs of animals used as food.
(3) As a metaphor for the heart.
(4) Muza, veneer. See "Lung Attachment".
[②]［pèi］
["Ji Yun" Pu Gaiqie, go to Thailand, Pang. ]
See "Lung 2 Lung".
lung

◎ Lung
haggis, lung
lung
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Not set next] [Fat Character Department] 　 Lung; Kangxi strokes: 10; Page number: page 976 24
[Guang Yun] Fang waste cut [Ji Yun] [Yun Hui] Fang waste cut, sound 㤄. [Said the text] Jin Zang also. [Jade articles] The words of the lungs also apply. 【Zhengzitong】The lungs hold the soul, six leaves and two ears, eight leaves, attached to the third vertebrae of the spine. [Suwen] People with lungs, according to legend, govern the festival out of Yan. 【Rite·Music Ceremony】Niangu does not climb, and the king’s meal does not sacrifice the lungs. [Note] Ceremony, sacrifice before eating and killing animals. There are Yu's first, Xiahou's heart, Yin's liver, Zhou's lungs. Not offering sacrifices to the lungs means that not killing animals is a great meal. Also 【Month Order】Meng Xia month, sacrifice the first lung. [Historical Records · Music Book] Business moves the lungs and is harmonious. [Huainanzi·Spirit Training] Lung is Qi. [Release name] Lung, 㪍 also. Yan Qi is also gloomy. [Bo Ya] Lung, Fei Ye.　Lungstone again. 【Zhou Li·Qiu Guan·Da Si Kou】Through the lung stones to reach the poor. [Note] Lung stone, Akashi is also. 【Sparse】Those who will make them sit on the red stone, so that they will not make false claims.　[Zheng Yun] Cut the wood. [Historical Records·Huijing Freelord Chronology] The children of the princes are like a heart and soul. [Note] Yuren is the relative of the end of the Nine Years, as if the wooden slab is out of the wood, and the bark is attached to the tree. [Previous Han·Chu Yuan Wang Biography] The ministers were fortunate to have their lungs attached. [Note] Firstly, the lungs are called the lungs of the wood. 【Yangtze·Tai? Scripture】The lungs are attached to dry rice. [Note] Cut to say lungs, and then to attach. [Zhengzitong] Mu is attached to the wood, such as the lung attached to the liver, and the pavilion is separated from the lung. This meaning is also incomprehensible. Rhyming, reading
lung
Source glyph
lung
Name meaning
One of the respiratory organs of humans and higher animals, later as a metaphor for the depths of the heart, it is like the words of the heart and soul.
会意字。从肉(月),其形像块肉,表示肺是体内的呼吸器官;从市,市有遮蔽意,表示肺被肌肤所遮蔽。本义是肺脏。
肺脏,人和高等动物体内的呼吸器官:~病|~结核|狼
心狗~(比喻心肠狠毒或忘恩负义)。
~癌 ~部~腑 ~科 ~勝~炎 ~叶 ~脏
~蛭 ~腑之言 润~ 感人~腑

fèi
%|肺|肺
稽
Зная слово.
От мяса (луны) его форма похожа на кусок мяса, что означает, что легкие - это органы дыхания в теле; от города город имеет значение покрытия, что означает, что легкие покрыты кожей. .
Первоначальное значение - легкие.
Легкие, органы дыхания у людей и высших животных: ~ болезнь | ~ туберкулез | волчье сердце ~ (например, порочное сердце или неблагодарность).
~ Рак ~ Отдел ~ Фу ~ Кэ ~ Шэн ~ Воспаление ~ Лист ~ Занг ~ Пиявка ~ Слова Фу ~ Движение ~ Фу
легкое

fèi, pèi
I fèi
1) анат., мед. лёгкое, лёгкие; лёгочный; пневмо-
肺体操法 упражнения для лёгких, дыхательная гимнастика
肺结核 туберкулёз лёгких
肺静(动)脉 лёгочная вена (артерия)
肺百斯笃, 肺鼠疫 лёгочная чума
肺软化 пневмомаляция
肺胸膜炎 пневмоплеврит
肺出血 пневморрагия
2) перен. сердце, душа; настроения, помыслы
II pèi
см. 肺肺
Radicals: 月, 市  (moon, city)
Meaning Mnemonic
There is a moon and a city inside your lung. Inside of your lung there is a city and above that city lies a moon. It’s a pretty sight, but also very strange. Moons and cities don’t usually reside inside lungs.
Imagine having a moon and a city inside your lung. Feel their presence as you breathe in and breathe out. Also, 月 often refers to internal organs as well, so remember that when you see this kanji.
Reading Mnemonic
Having a moon and city inside your lung inspires you to write a haiku (はい). Perhaps the city and moon are just metaphorical. Either way, a haiku is the best way to go about things here.
The city and moon
Inside my lung, forgotten.
Where is the answer?
Or just think of your own haiku. Be creative!
